core_definition.goal: Coach effectively, forecast accurately, hit team quota
core_definition.pain: Can't be on every call, reactive coaching, tool complexity, data fragmentation
core_definition.success: Spots issues early, targeted coaching, team at 100% quota

executive_leader.description: C-Suite or VP with budget authority, delegates evaluation

distinguishing_traits.quote_example: The real question is, what does that whole lot of sense cost?

sdr_leader.description: Head of SDR/BDR, built function from ground up, hands-on

distinguishing_traits.quote_example: We have like 200 tools. Do any of them talk to each other? Sort of.

small_team_leader.description: Leads small team with no RevOps support, does everything

distinguishing_traits.quote_example: I'm just not gonna do anything and probably overpay because I don't have the time

typical_pain_points: Tool proliferation - 200 tools that don't talk to each other
Data fragmentation across HubSpot, Outreach, Gong, etc.
Closed-lost deal re-engagement is manual nightmare
AE to CS handoff loses critical context
CRM hygiene on SDR front is horrible
Can't listen to every call to coach effectively
Forecast accuracy suffers from inconsistent rep data
Migration pain prevents evaluating better solutions
typical_fears: Migration will be too painful and time-consuming
Another tool that doesn't integrate with existing stack
Will have to support this on top of everything else
AI will add complexity without delivering value
Tool won't be simple enough for team adoption
typical_voice_quotes: We have like 200 tools. Do any of them talk to each other? Sort of.
The real question is, what does that whole lot of sense cost?
If that is too painful or too lengthy, I'm just not gonna do anything and probably overpay
I don't have anybody in rev ops or anything like that
That AE to CS handoff is huge because all of that can get lost in an instant
On the SDR front, CRM hygiene is horrible. I mean, it's not heinous, but definitely not great.
I know they're not happy with recruiting, which is why that's the lowest hanging fruit for me

behavioral_patterns.error_response: Escalates or assigns someone to figure it out
behavioral_patterns.help_seeking: Delegates to team member or ops person
behavioral_patterns.abandonment_trigger: ROI unclear after first month OR migration too painful
behavioral_patterns.evaluation_style: Consensus-builder for SDR leaders; quick ROI decision for executives
